+android_bp_template_recovery = \
+'''
+prebuilt_firmware {{
+    name: "linux_firmware_{name}_recovery",
+    // In general linux-firmware gets pulled in by a product adding it
+    // to PRODUCT_PACKAGES, so we don't need visibility to anything outside
+    // of linux-firmware. We allow visibility between all the linux-firmware
+    // sub-packages so that one linux-firmare can use `required` for other
+    // linux-firmware.
+    visibility: ["//external/linux-firmware:__subpackages__"],
+    licenses: ["linux_firmware_{name}_license"],
+    srcs: [{fw_files}],
+    dsts: [{fw_files}],
+    recovery: true,
+    required: [{required}],
+}}
+'''
+

 # Automatically create the Android.bp file under the directory `name`.
-def create_android_bp_file(ctx, name, license_kind, fw_files, required, symlink_stanzas):
+def create_android_bp_file(ctx, name, license_kind, fw_files, required,
+                           symlink_stanzas, recovery):
     output = android_bp_template.format(
         name = name,
         license_kinds = format_android_bp_string_arr([license_kind]),
         license_files = format_android_bp_string_arr(['LICENSE']),
         fw_files = format_android_bp_string_arr(fw_files),
         required = format_android_bp_string_arr(required),
+        recovery = recovery,
         symlink_stanzas = '\n\n'.join(symlink_stanzas),
         year = ctx.now_as_string('yyyy'),
     )
+
+    if recovery:
+        output += android_bp_template_recovery.format(
+            name = name,
+            fw_files = format_android_bp_string_arr(fw_files),
+            required = format_android_bp_string_arr(required),
+        )
+
     ctx.write_path(ctx.new_path(name + '/Android.bp'), output)

+    visibility: ["//visibility:private"],
+    license_kinds: ["BSD-Binary-Only"],
+    license_text: ["LICENSE"],
+}
+
+prebuilt_firmware {
+    name: "linux_firmware_i915_mtl",
+    // In general linux-firmware gets pulled in by a product adding it
+    // to PRODUCT_PACKAGES, so we don't need visibility to anything outside
+    // of linux-firmware. We allow visibility between all the linux-firmware
+    // sub-packages so that one linux-firmare can use `required` for other
+    // linux-firmware.
+    visibility: ["//external/linux-firmware:__subpackages__"],
+    licenses: ["linux_firmware_i915_mtl_license"],
+    srcs: [
+        "i915/mtl_dmc.bin",
+        "i915/mtl_dmc_ver2_10.bin",
+        "i915/mtl_gsc_1.bin",
+        "i915/mtl_guc_70.bin",

+    name: "linux_firmware_iwlwifi-so-a0-gf-a0-89",
+    // In general linux-firmware gets pulled in by a product adding it
+    // to PRODUCT_PACKAGES, so we don't need visibility to anything outside
+    // of linux-firmware. We allow visibility between all the linux-firmware
+    // sub-packages so that one linux-firmare can use `required` for other
+    // linux-firmware.
